page.title: 03D.I.Y. IN PONTESBURY.
page.content: The DIY shop has been here for 64 years. It used to be an outfitting shop. The opening hours are 9.00am to 5.30pm with a half day on Thursday. The hours have changed and become less over the years. There are four people working in the shop and the owner has been running the business for 23 years. Business is good at the moment and the most common sales items are decorating materials. Monday is a good sales day because it is housewives shopping day, but Saturday is a good day as well. The shop is l500 sq.ft. in size and has been extended in recent years. The estimated value of the business is about 55,000 pounds. The most common items sold are nails, paints, hammers, locks, screws, rope, pots, steps, plugs, knives, switches, hinges, string, seeds, nuts, bolts and buckets
